intro: Descurainia pinnata subsp. nelsonii, commonly known as Nelson's tansy, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, yellow flowers and pinnately divided leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. It has a short stature, usually reaching up to 30 cm in height, and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and habitat restoration.
